p: First of all, the general public underestimates how serious and dangerous and serious the flu actually is – especially for the most vulnerable, the elderly and those who are already ill. Globally, influenza causes between 250 000 and 650 000 deaths annually, depending on the strain of the circulating virus [ 18]. Different strains can cause milder or more severe symptoms, and the virus mutates each year. However, we try to protect those most vulnerable before the flu season begins by vaccinating them.
